LOC_STRING.br: Click to select a map and run a zoo. You may select specific game challenges, but you will have no primary goals.
Click to select a map and run a zoo. You can play with unlimited money, and all animals and objects are available.
Click to select a campaign to play. Each campaign has several scenarios, all with specific goals to complete.
Click to change video, sound, and other game options.
Click to check the Internet for game updates and new content. You can also enable or disable downloaded content.
Click to play a previously saved game.
Click to exit Zoo Tycoon 2 and return to Windows.
Click to load the selected player profile.
Click to delete the selected player profile.
Click to create a new player profile.
Click to add, delete, or select a player profile.
Click to close the Profile Manager.

LOC_STRING.br: Click to make no changes and close the Save Game dialog box.
Click to save the game using the name you've entered.
Click to delete the selected saved game.
Click to close the Load Game dialog box without loading a game.
Click to load the selected saved game.
Click to delete the selected saved game.

font.name: arial
font.b: Press Spacebar to take a picture

LOC_STRING.br: Click to close this help screen.

color.b: Left click the "X button" to close this panel.
Press the "C" key to toggle the camera on and off.
Press the "SPACE BAR" to take a photo.

LOC_STRING.br: Click to select a new or existing photo album.
Click to create and name a new photo album
Click to delete the selected photo album.

color.b: Delete All Photos From Album button

LOC_STRING.br: Click to delete all the photos in this photo album.

color.b: Delete all Photos From Camera button

LOC_STRING.br: Click to clear the film and delete all photos from the camera.
Click to delete the selected photos.
Click to move the selected photo to the current photo album.

color.b: Export Photo Album to HTML button

LOC_STRING.br: Click to export the selected photo album to HTML.
Click to display the previous page in the photo album.
Click to display the next page in the photo album.
Click to close the photo album and return to the game.
Click to return to the photo album.
Click to select a photo or double-click to enlarge the photo.
Click to use the currently selected album.
Click to change video and audio options, including video mode, quality, resolution and volume control.
Select to play Zoo Tycoon 2 in full-screen mode.
Select to play Zoo Tycoon 2 in a window.
Select to play Zoo Tycoon 2 with the highest video quality. This may cause slower game performance.
Select to play Zoo Tycoon 2 with medium video quality. This may improve game performance.
Select to play Zoo Tycoon 2 with the lowest video quality. This may improve game performance.
Select to choose your own custom settings for performance.
Select to play Zoo Tycoon 2 in a resolution of 1280 by 1024 pixels.
Select to play Zoo Tycoon 2 in a resolution of 1024 by 768 pixels.
Select to play Zoo Tycoon 2 in a resolution of 800 by 600 pixels.

font.name: arial
font.br: Slide this bar to change the level of Shadow detail displayed in the game world.

font.name: arial
font.br: Slide this bar to change the level of detailed objects displayed in the terrain, including small tufts of grass and rocks that are appropriate to the terrain's biome type.

LOC_STRING.br: Click to exit down load screen and return to the game.
Click to apply all selected changes and exit now.
Click to adjust the master volume and music volume levels.
Click to increase the master volume sound level, which includes animal and environment sound effects.
Click to decrease the master volume sound level, which includes animal and environment sound effects.
Slide this bar left or right to change the master volume sound level, which includes animal and environment sound effects.
Click to increase the volume level of the music that plays when the menus are displayed.
Click to decrease the volume level of the menu music.

color.b: Change Menu Music Volume slider control

LOC_STRING.br: Slide this bar left or right to change the menu music volume.
Click to change first person mode and Message of the Day options.
Select to have the ability to look around your zoo using the mouse while in 1st person mode.

color.b: Enable Message of the Day check box

LOC_STRING.br: Select to allow Zoo Tycoon 2 to connect to the Internet, download new messages, and display them on the main menu.

ZT2Strings.LOC_STRING: Enable Message of the Day check box
Enable or Disable Content check box

color.b: Enable or Disable Content check box

LOC_STRING.br: Select to allow or disable downloaded content in Zoo Tycoon 2.
Select to goto the directory inwhich the new content is stored.
Click to switch to the overview map where you can see all of your zoo.
Click to switch to an overhead view that allows you to build and place objects in your zoo.
Click to switch to a 1st person view, where you can walk around your zoo from a guest's perspective.
Click to switch to the Photo Safari view, where you can take photographs of the animals and objects in your zoo.
Click to view the Construction panel, where you can buy fences, paths, buildings, benches, fountains, trash cans, and more.
This tab shows the fences and gates you can buy.
Click to start fence placement, and then drag the mouse to adjust the size of the octagonal fence. Click again to complete the fence.
Click to start fence placement, and then drag the mouse to adjust the size of the rectangular fence. Click again to complete the fence.
Click to place one section of fence.
Click and then drag the mouse to construct multiple fence sections.
Click to start fence placement. Subsequent clicks will place additional fence sections. Right-click to complete placing fence sections.
This tab shows the different types of paths you can buy.
Click to view the Animals panel, where you can adopt animals or buy enrichment objects and animal food.
Click to decline this animal for adoption.
Click to view the female animals you can adopt.
Click to view the male animals you can adopt.
This tab shows the animals you can adopt.
This tab shows the toys and enrichment objects that you can buy for your animals.
This tab shows the food you can buy for your animals.
This tab shows the different types of shelters you can buy for your animals.
Click to view the structures panel, where you can buy buildings and scenery objects.
This tab shows the scenery objects you can buy, including seating options, trash cans, decorative arches, fountains, and statues.
This tab shows the buildings you can buy, including food and beverage stands, restaurants, and restrooms.
Click to view the Landscaping panel, where you can place tree, plants, and rocks, and create hills, valleys, lakes.
This tab shows the six terrain manipulation tools you can use to flatten or smooth surfaces and create cliffs, mountains, and plateaus.
Click to select the Create Hill brush. Then click or click and hold on the terrain to create hills.
Click to select the Create Valley brush. Then click or click and hold on the terrain to create valleys of varying depths.
Click to select the Create Plateau brush. Then click or click and hold on the terrain to flatten raised terrain and create plateaus.
Click to select the Smooth Terrain brush. Then click or click and hold on the terrain to smooth rough terrain or to create smooth hills.
Click to select the Create Cliff brush. Then click or click and hold on the terrain to create cliffs.
Click to select the Ditch Digger brush. Then click or click and hold on the terrain to create ditches.
On this tab, you can choose a biome type and then use the mouse to paint the terrain with plants, trees, and other elements that are appropriate for selected biome.
Click to change to the previous biome.
Click to change to the next biome.
Click to increase the size of the area the biome brush paints each time you click the mouse.
Click o decrease the size of the area the biome brush paints each time you click the mouse.
This tab shows the different types of trees you can buy.
This tab shows different types of plants you can buy.
This tab shows the rocks you can buy.
Click to view the Staff panel, where you can hire staff members, including zookeepers, maintenance workers, and educators.
On this tab, you can choose male or female staff members including zookeepers, maintenance workers, and educators.
On this tab, you can choose a male or female zookeeper. A zookeeper can take care of all of the needs of the animals in your zoo.
On this tab, you can hire maintenance workers who will empty trash cans and clean up animal droppings in your zoo.
On this tab, you can hire educators, who can give informative talks to guests about animals, satisfying their thirst for knowledge.
Click to zoom in for a closer look at your zoo.
Click to zoom out for a higher-level look at your zoo.
Click to rotate your view of the zoo in a counter-clockwise direction.
Click to rotate your view of the zoo in a clockwise direction.
Click to access information about your animals, guests, staff, and buildings.
Click to undo your last action.
Click to display information about current challenges.
Click to change the mouse cursor to a bulldozer. Then, point to any object in the zoo and click to delete it.
Click to display information about the current scenario goals.
Click to display the Game Options menu, where you can save games, load games, return to the main menu, or exit Zoo Tycoon 2.
Click to display information about zoo finances, including income and expenses, graphs, awards, and donations.
Click to view and organize photos taken in photo safari mode.

Rotate Object Clockwise button
Click to rotate this object in a clockwise direction before placing it.

Rotate Object Counter-clockwise button
Click to rotate this object in a counter-clockwise direction before placing it.

Click to reduce the Game Controls panel to its minimum size, obscuring your view of your zoo as little as possible.

Click to cancel and return to Profile Manager.

Click to create a new photo album, where you can view and organize the photos you've taken of your zoo.

Click to view and adjust zoo admission price and to check your zoo's operational status.

Click to open the zoo for guests to enjoy.
Click to close the zoo. No guests will visit when the zoo is closed.
Click this button to access the zoopedia and get infomation about this entity.
Click this button to start researching this entity.
Click this button to get zookeeper recommendations for this animal.
Click to view the Animal Status panel.
Click to review the status of the animal's basic and advanced needs.
Click to view the animal's gender, biome preference, and geographical location.

LOC_STRING.br: Click to put this animal up for adoption so that other zoos may consider acquiring it.
Click to release this animal into the wild, an important step in conservation efforts.
Click to pick up the selected animal wherever it is located in the zoo.

Click to uncrate the selected animal wherever it is located in the zoo.

Click to view a list of the current guest's zoo favorites.
Click to view guest status.
Click to view the current guest's activities and to review his or her basic needs.
Click to close this panel.
Click to pick up the selected animal wherever it's located in your zoo.
Click to track the selected guest wherever it is located in the zoo.
Click to view the Zoopedia topic that describes this object.
Click to pick up the selected guest wherever he or she is located in your zoo.
Click to pick up the selected building or structure wherever it is located in your zoo.

Click to sell the selected object. Any profit you make will be automatically added to your bank account.

Click to track the selected staff memeber wherever it is located in the zoo.
